programme.desc: Maryland (25-7) defeated Alabama, 111-108, in double OT behind 28 points from Shyanne Sellers; South Carolina (32-3), the defending champions, earned its 10th-straight Sweet 16 berth with a 64-53 win over Indiana behind a Chloe Kitts double-double.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: North Carolina (29-7) and Duke (28-7) split two regular-season meetings, including a 53-46 Tar Heels win in overtime on Jan. 9 behind an Alyssa Ustby double-double before a 68-53 Blue Devils victory on Feb. 27 behind 23 points from Reigan Richardson.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Oklahoma (27-7) blew out Iowa, 96-62, to advance behind 17 points from Skylar Vann; UConn (33-3) makes its 31st-straight Sweet 16 appearance after a 91-57 win over South Dakota State behind 34 points from Paige Bueckers and 17 from Azzi Fudd.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Ole Miss (22-10) used a strong second half to beat Baylor, 69-63, and advance behind 16 points from Sira Thienou; UCLA (32-2) makes its third-straight Sweet 16 appearance after an 84-67 win over Richmond behind 30 points from Lauren Betts.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: UAB (24-12) used a strong fourth quarter to beat Santa Clara, 88-84, behind 22 points, 11 rebounds and seven assists from Yaxel Lendeborg; UC Irvine (30-6) held on to beat Jacksonville State, 66-61, behind 22 points from Justin Hohn.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Director Kirk Fraser takes an in-depth look at what truly happened on the night that college basketball star Len Bias died of a cocaine overdose just 48 hours after being drafted second overall by the Boston Celtics in 1986.

programme.desc: Jalen Rose, Juwan Howard, Jimmy King, Ray Jackson and coaches discuss their time at the University of Michigan, reliving the recruitment process that brought the Fab Five together in 1991 and their two appearances in the NCAA Championship Game.

programme.title: College Hockey
programme.desc: Penn State comes off of a 4-3 overtime defeat to Ohio State in the Big Ten semifinals on March 15 with a goal and assist from Matt DiMarsico; Maine beat Connecticut, 5-2, in the Hockey East Championship on March 21 behind a Taylor Makar brace.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night
programme.desc: Brandon Moreno (22-8-2) goes up against Steve Erceg (12-3-0) in the flyweight main event; Manuel Torres (15-3) faces Drew Dober (27-14) in the lightweight co-main event; Kelvin Gastelum (19-9) goes up against Joe Pyfer (13-3) in a middleweight bout.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.desc: Scheduled UFC on ESPN 64 preliminary bouts: Edgar Chavez (11-6-0) vs. CJ Vergara (12-6-1) in a flyweight bout; Jose Daniel Medina (11-4) vs. Ateba Gautier (1-0) in a middleweight bout; Christian Rodriguez (12-2) vs. Melquizael Costa (22-7).

programme.desc: In 1983, North Carolina State suffered 10 losses in the regular season and had to overcome national powerhouses to win the ACC Tournament and qualify for the NCAA Tournament, where the Wolfpack mounted a memorable run to the national championship.

programme.desc: Roki Sasaki appeared in two spring training games for the Dodgers and recorded seven strikeouts over seven innings with a 0.00 ERA; Justin Steele threw 134.2 innings in 24 starts for the Cubs last season, and he was 5-5 with a 3.07 ERA.

programme.title: THE GAME THAT CHANGED EVERYTHING: Yankees vs Red Sox '04 ALCS
Walk-Off Stories
programme.desc: National League MVP Kirk Gibson, who was hobbled by leg injuries in the NLCS, was used as a pinch-hitter in Game 1 of the 1988 World Series, his only at-bat of the series, and would provide one of the most memorable home runs in MLB history.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his fourth Truck Series win of his career with his victory at Homestead over Layne Riggs; Christian Eckes won both races at Martinsville last year, defeating Ty Majeski by .644 seconds and Ben Rhodes by 1.191 seconds.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The third major tournament of the 2025 season features 15 games of qualifying over three days with the top 63 players plus the defending champion competing in the double-elimination match-play bracket; DeeRonn Booker is the defending champion.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Geelong (1-1-0) fell to St. Kilda. 98-91, in Round 2; Brisbane (2-0-0) has won two of the past three encounters against the Cats, including a 95-65 victory last season in the Preliminary Finals at MCG, as Ollie Henry had four goals from 15 disposals.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: The Rover of Tobruk
programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.title: NASCAR Masters of the Clock: The Legend of Martinsville
programme.desc: Martinsville Speedway remains as the lone race track to be a part of the NASCAR circuit since its inception in 1948 and remains the shortest track on the Sprint Cup Series schedule, and drivers share some of their memories racing in Virginia.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Antron Brown leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 22 points, Chad Green leads Ron Capps in Funny Car by 14 points and Dallas Glenn leads Greg Anderson in Pro Stock by 18 points after Gainesville, the first event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series
programme.desc: The top competitors from around the world compete in the AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series, the premier snowmobile racing event in North America, featuring racers competing on a track with big jumps, highlights of top moments and interviews.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Port Adelaide (1-1-0) has won the past eight meetings with the Bombers, including a 111-42 victory last season, as Connor Rozee had a career-high 36 disposals and kicked three goals; Essendon (0-2-0) comes off a 161-100 loss to Adelaide in Round 2.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Josh Berry secured his first Cup Series win of his career with his victory at Las Vegas over Daniel Suarez, ending the three-race win streak of Christopher Bell; Tyler Reddick averaged 129.379 mph to win at Homestead last year over Ryan Blaney.

programme.title: NHRA Sportsman Series
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in different classifications; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various drag-racing classes.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Birmingham defeated Michigan, 31-18, to advance behind two passing TDs from Matt Corral; San Antonio beat St. Louis, 25-15, and won its season meeting with the Stallions, 18-9, on May 25 behind two rushing touchdowns from Morgan Ellison.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Dolphins (0-0-3) is just 1-0-3 all-time against Brisbane (2-0-1) but won the last meeting with a 40-6 triumph last season at Suncorp Stadium in Round 26, as Jake Averillo, Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow and Herbie Farnworth each notched a brace.

programme.title: NRL Hits Vegas
programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio (7-3) led the UFL in total defense and scoring defense after allowing just 256.7 yards per game and 15.3 points per contest; St. Louis (7-3) won both encounters against the Brahmas this season after its 13-12 triumph at home in Week 10.

Pickleball
programme.desc: Players compete on the Championship Court in men's and women's doubles on the third day of the tournament; Ben Johns, Anna Leigh Waters, Federico Staksrund, Catherine Parenteau, Collin Johns and Rachel Rohrabacher headline the field.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Qualifying
programme.desc: Truck Series drivers attempt to qualify for the upcoming race in Martinsville and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position; Ty Majeski averaged 97.523 mph en route to winning the pole last year before finishing in second.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Jurez claimed victories over Puebla in their last two consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Sept. 27 with a 3-2 scoreline; Jairo Torres, Jose Garcia and scar Estupin found the net for Jurez in the win away from home.

programme.title: Destined to Drive: Patrick Dempsey's Return to Racing
MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: A field of the world's top bowlers compete in the second PBA major of the season with the winner taking home $100,000; EJ Tackett of Blufton, Ind., which enters the competition atop the PBA World Championship standings, is the defending champion.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: GWS (2-0-0) has won four of the past three meetings with the Hawks, including an 84-82 triumph last season in Round 21, as the Giants scored seven goals in final term; Hawthorn (3-0-0) sits atop the ladder after defeating Carlton, 80-60, in Round 3.
